intro: Gymnopteris ceterach, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a member of the family Blechnaceae. It is a large, evergreen fern that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its tall, unbranched trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a distinctive, fibrous trunk that is covered with remnants of old fronds, giving it a tree-like appearance. Its fronds are typically dark green and have a leathery texture, with a prominent midrib. Gymnopteris ceterach is native to New Zealand and thrives in moist, shaded environments.
